All inter-dimensional travelers such as yourself must acquire visitant status in order to journey within Abyssea.
To be granted this status, you must provide me with ${keyitem-plural: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Having come from a different plane of existence, your existential phase is unaligned to that of Abyssea.
To overcome this problem, ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} is required. It acts as a stabilizing agent that aligns and anchors your essence to Abyssea for prolonged periods of time.${prompt}
Bereft of its effect, your essence will become unraveled within a matter of minutes, after which you will be expelled to your own reality.
Do make a habit of first coming to me upon arrival in Abyssea.${prompt}
A word of warning. As the presence of unaligned entities may have adverse effects on this dimension, only those with visitant status are permitted to venture beyond the searing ward.${prompt}
Those without visitant status will be forcibly returned to the searing ward's vicinity.
This is a preventative measure against the detrimental effects of inter-dimensional “noise.”${prompt}
When requesting visitant status, please indicate the number of ${keyitem-plural: 0[2]} you wish to process.
A greater number will allow you a longer stay.${prompt}
It is also possible to extend your visitant status by bringing me more ${keyitem-plural: 0[2]}.${prompt}
To obtain ${keyitem-plural: 0[2]}, you must seek out Joachim. He is currently a resident of your world, Vana'diel.${prompt}
Lastly, I will explain in detail the myriad effects granted by the visitant status.${prompt}

Many are the reports of positive things occurring while under its auspices, from a general upturn in fortunes to more specific benefits such as accelerated growth and greater ease of cruor harvesting.${prompt}
Naturally, these benefits will not come to the idle.

Atma is most accurately described as the crystalline agglomeration of an Abyssean creature's soul.
Through painstaking research, we infusionists have discovered a way to imbue ordinary people such as yourself with its power.${prompt}
Infusion makes possible the augmentation of individuals, granting them powers particular to the creature from which the atma is sourced.${prompt}
The infusion process requires three objects: an atma, ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, and cruor.${prompt}
And it won't please you to know that atma is rarer still.${prompt}
For only the most savage creatures, you see, are known to yield atma.
And if you thought that weren't trial enough, only by employing special combat strategies will atma be yours to own.${prompt}
Atma-yielding monsters are known to have vulnerabilities that, if exploited, may result in a swift end to the confrontation.${prompt}
Strike at a foe's weakness, and it will drop different spoils, often more valuable than usual. Among them you may find atma.${prompt}
The vulnerabilities can broadly be divided into three categories: magic attacks, physical-based weapon skills, and magic-based weapon skills.${prompt}
For instance, there are monsters known to be weak against magic-based weapon skills.
Inflicting such damage upon them will impair their movement, and you may consequently be rewarded with atma.${prompt}
All living creatures, however, possess the capacity to adapt, and vulnerabilities have been observed to change.
Be wary if you wish not to discover to your sorrow that a once-foolproof strategy no longer applies.${prompt}
Besting such fell creatures is in itself a harrowing task, and becomes even more so if procuring atma is your objective.${prompt}
But should fortune smile upon you and you find yourself in possession of atma, bring it here.
I will see that it serves you well.${prompt}

Greetings. I am an atma fabricant--or, to the layman, one who fabricates atma.
I can synthesize atma from the memories of adventure stored deep within your body and soul.
If you have need of my services, you need only speak the word.${prompt}
Ask for something?
${selection-lines}

Synthetic atma?
My memories?
Show me the atma.${prompt}
As you are no doubt aware, the substance we call atma is a crystalline agglomeration of soul energy that can be harvested from the bodies of fallen Abyssean fiends.${prompt}
The abundant power that it imbues when infused into our bodies is not in question.
The perilous means by which it must be acquired, however, leaves something to be desired.${prompt}
After all, bolstering the strength of one man means little if ten others must lose their lives in the process.
Thus was the impetus behind our research: to discover a means for extracting atma from resources at our immediate disposal.${prompt}
We experimented with nearly every substance in sight--be it animal, vegetable, or mineral.
Yet each time, the atma produced was small, fragile, and entirely absent of the power we sought.${prompt}
Then, one day, we hit upon the obvious answer that we had so long overlooked...ourselves.
Yes, the atma extracted from our own bodies--particularly those richly possessed of experiences and memories--these housed a power rivalling that harvested from the most vicious of fiends.${prompt}
If you possess such memories, then I can bring forth the latent power that resides within you as well.${prompt}
Fear not, for there is everything to gain and nothing to lose.
Save for some cruor, that is...${prompt}
Curious, is it not?
That potent physical energy can be extracted from such a tenuous, intangible thing...${prompt}
But the strength our memories and experiences give us is real, if all too easily overlooked.
Once isolated, it is simply a matter of recalling it, solidifying it, and bringing it to the fore.${prompt}
Surely you understand of what it is I speak, yes?
Your greatest accomplishments--those that make others stand in wonderment and admiration when you they hear your name.${prompt}
We summon forth the energies from the deepest recesses of your psyche, and infuse it into the cruor you carry.
The resultant agglomeration of organic mineral and soul energy is synthetic atma.${prompt}
Mind you, the deeper and more puissant your energies, the more cruor will be necessary to contain it all.
If you wish to have me assay the powers that lie dormant within you, simply speak the word.${prompt}
Very well. We shall see what latent powers you possess.
Stand still and clear your mind...${prompt}
Yes...it is as I thought...
Long and far have you traveled...many a battle have you fought...${prompt}
Which shall I extract?${prompt}
...And yet, I see nothing tangible enough for me to process.
I am sorry.${prompt}

These martellos are defensive fortifications developed by the resistance to aid in our battle against the fell hordes.
Enchanted structures, they may be employed to restore your health and magic, cure ailments, and generally restore you to fighting trim.${prompt}
I have been entrusted with the supervision and maintenance of these martellos...but this is none of your concern.${prompt}
I have been entrusted with the supervision and maintenance of these martellos.
Would you be needing something of me?${prompt}
Need something?
${selection-lines}
Assist with replenishment.
Assist with upgrades.
Martellos? Come again?
Nothing in particular.${prompt}
Splendid! Your aid is a great boon to the resistance effort.
To replenish a martello, you'll need to insert one of these ${keyitem-plural: 0[2]} into the structure.${prompt}
Be forewarned: you will be unable to carry these and ${keyitem-plural: 1[2]} at the same time.${prompt}
Take along the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}?
${selection-lines}
Yes.
No.${prompt}
We would be particularly indebted to you for efficient replenishment of martellos in remote locations.
Best of luck in your efforts!${prompt}
Why, is that not ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} already in your posssesion?
You need only insert that into a martello to initiate replenishment.${prompt}
I see that you currently possess ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}.
Do you wish to abandon your upgrading efforts and participate in replenishment instead?${prompt}
You return the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} and obtain ${keyitem-article: 1[2]} in its stead!${prompt}
Your support is most heartening in these dark times.
Upgrading a martello will require you to attach a device known as ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Mind you, the device is rather unwieldy.
You will not be able to carry it and ${keyitem-article: 1[2]} at the same time.${prompt}
Excellent. I would be especially appreciative if you could upgrade those martellos in distant locations--the quicker the better.
Be careful out there!${prompt}
Hm? Is that not ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} you hold in your hand?
You need only find the martello you wish to upgrade, and attach it.${prompt}
Is that ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} I see?
Do you wish to curtail your replenishment activities and assist with upgrading instead?${prompt}
Welcome back, friend! Allow me to take that ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} off your hands.
How did you fare in your efforts?${prompt}
I see, I see... Martello #0${number: 1}, you say?
It sounds as if the operation was ${choice: 0}[a modest success./a reasonable success./a rousing success!/an unqualified success!]${prompt}
The resistance greatly values your contributions.
Take this as a small token of our appreciation, and do not hesitate to return the next time you are willing to lend your support.${prompt}
I've been working with these here martellos since I was knee-high.
Ask away, and my knowledge is yours.${prompt}
Ask something?
${selection-lines}
So, what's a martello?
Martello replenishment.
Martello upgrades.
Cautionary notes.
Not now.${prompt}
The device we know as the martello was first developed by military engineers many years past, during an age of great war.
Martellos serve to keep combatants fighting fit, healing their wounds and restoring their mental energies.${prompt}

You will observe that martellos have been constructed in numerous locales, so as to provide strategically located safe havens for harried resistance fighters. No doubt you will find yourself making use of them as well.${prompt}
In the bowels of each martello is contained a tank designed to hold martello fuel.${prompt}
This ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} is the lifeblood of the martello, and the source of its curative powers.
Depleted stores will render the device little more than an oversized parchmentweight.${prompt}
That being the case, we're in continual need of volunteers willing to take on the vital task of replenishing these martellos.${prompt}
I have been charged with overseeing a supply of martello fuel.
Should you be willing to take part in a replenishment run, you need only say the word.
Needless to say, you will not go unrewarded for your efforts.${prompt}
Feast your eyes on this ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}. She's a beauty, isn't she?
Installing one of these into a martello will increase its fuel capacity.${prompt}
An upgraded martello will be able to sustain its energy stores for a longer time between replenishment operations.
Needless to say, this is a blessing and a half to those on the battlefield.${prompt}
Unfortunately, the installation procedure is quite complex.
As such, we can only entrust it to experienced hands.${prompt}
Even the burliest among us would be unable to carry one and ${keyitem-article: 1[2]} at the same time.${prompt}
Furthermore, these materials are quite unstable, and will rapidly corrode and be rendered useless if brought outside our immediate environs.${prompt}
'Course, not that anyone could manage to travel that far, what with these fearsome landslides...${prompt}
Changing areas, logging out, or becoming disconnected will cause all data pertinent to this quest to be reset.
Your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} has been lost.
The resistance is currently suffering a materials shortage.
Those wishing to participating in replenishment and upgrading operations should return at a later time.${prompt}
The ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} breaks!
Table: ${number: 0}
You there! We're in need of a few good ${choice-player-gender}[men/women].
If you've time to stand about, how about lending your strength to the cause?${prompt}
Yours is an unfamiliar face.
What do they call you?${prompt}
Pleased to make your acquaintance, ${name-player}.
As I said a moment ago, we could certainly use your aid.${prompt}
We came under attack from a particularly vicious horde not hours ago, you see.
Fortunately, we suffered no casualties, but the searing ward protecting our encampment is on its last legs.${prompt}
If the ward breaks, you can bet we'll be overrun with fiends in the blink of an eye. We must repair it, and immediately.
Raibaht is in charge of maintenance, but we need someone to deliver to him the necessary materials.${prompt}
The supplies may be found scattered throughout this encampment.
Collect them, and make haste! The enemy is ever snapping at our heels.${prompt}
What are you still doing here?
You must collect the materials needed to repair the ward and deliver them to Raibaht with all speed!${prompt}
Yes, those are the materials Raibaht needs.
Deliver them to him with haste, and report back to me when the deed is done.${prompt}
You've brought those for me? Much obliged, friend.
I'll get right on the repairs. You can tell Captain Ayame that the ward'll hold steady for a while longer.${prompt}
Oh, it's you again.
Have you not reported back to Captain Ayame? You'd best be on your way.${prompt}
Thank you, friend. You've served us well.
Are you with another regiment, perhaps? I've not seen you around these parts before.
In any event, I should explain.${prompt}
I am Ayame, a captain of the resistance effort.
In the days before the Republic fell, I served as one of the Mythril Musketeers, the president's finest.${prompt}
Yes, fell. I say, did you take a blow to the head somewhere along your journey?
Why, there has been no Bastok ever since the first wave of fiends came and reduced the Metalworks to little more than a smoldering scrap heap.${prompt}
Our vaunted Republican Army was soon overwhelmed--it was all we could do to round up the surviving civilians and lead them to safer ground.${prompt}
...${prompt}
We thought to make for Gustaberg, until a massive landslide--unlike any I'd ever seen--sealed the path off right before our eyes.
Left with nowhere else to run, we set up a makeshift base of operations here, from which we wage a desperate struggle for our very survival.${prompt}
I know not where you hail from, but in this land, we must pool all of our wits and strength just to live to see the morrow.
If you would be of aid to our cause, seek out the engineer Raibaht once more. He should have a suitable task for you.
Now, I must return to my duties. Go safely, friend!${prompt}
You return. Have you not yet spoken with Raibaht?
If you've a mind to remain in our camp, we must ask you to assist in fortifying our defenses.
I wish I did not have to impose upon you in this way, but banding together is the only way we will pull through this grim age...${prompt}
Ah, the young ${choice-player-gender}[man/woman] who brought me my materials.
I'm much in your debt for that one.${prompt}
I've just finished up the preliminary repairs, but it'll be a while still before we're back to full strength.
And then I've got the martellos to look after. No rest for the weary engineer, I tell you.${prompt}
You're familiar with our martellos, are you not?${prompt}
Know about martellos?
${selection-lines}
Sure do.
Mar-what-os?${prompt}
Good. Saves me the trouble of a lengthy explanation.${prompt}
Is that so? I'm surprised anyone could make it this far without encountering one.
Very well. The martello is a defensive structure conceived by resistance engineers that serves as the keystone of our fortifications.${prompt}
They run on a sort of magical fuel, you see. So long as the tanks are kept full, they'll serve to heal your wounds and revitalize your battle-weary body and mind.
So long as the tanks are full--and therein lies the rub.${prompt}
What with all of us fighting for our lives, it's all too easy to neglect to replenish the things until it's too late.
That's why we all must learn to do our part.${prompt}
Here, take this ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} and find yourself a martello in need of replenishment.
It's a simple enough act, and one that could someday mean the difference between life and death for you or one of your comrades, so you'd do well to make a habit of it.${prompt}
See the martello just over yonder? Why don't you try your hand at replenishing its fuel stores while you're at it.
The more comfortable you become with the procedure, the better it will serve us all.${prompt}
Now that wasn't so difficult, was it?
The martellos you'll encounter in the field are key to our survival.
Should you see one in need of replenishment, we ask that you lend a helping hand.${prompt}
You've returned.
How about it? I trust you're an old hand with martellos by now?${prompt}
We've tasked a dedicated machine outfitter with the supervision of all martello-related matters around camp.${prompt}
Should you wish to assist further with replenishment and repair, I encourage you to seek him out.
He will furnish you with the necessary materials, as well as due recompense upon your successful return.${prompt}
Mind you, you'll want to report back swiftly after finishing the job.
We've far too much on our hands here to keep tabs on stragglers.${prompt}
There you are, ${name-player}.
Captain Ayame's been scouring the camp in search of you.
I suggest you report to her on the double.${prompt}
${name-player}. I'm glad you've come.
I've been watching you closely since you first arrived in our camp, and I stand convinced--you have the potential to be a great ally to our cause.${prompt}
I have a most vital task that I would entrust to you.
The linkshell that was our sole line of communication to our field regiments suffered irreparable damage in the last incursion.${prompt}
Working together we stand a chance, however slim. Splintered and isolated, we are as good as done for.
${name-player}. You must seek out our lost squadrons and deliver these linkpearls before it is too late.${prompt}
There are three regiments, all told.
One was on patrol just north of here when we lost contact with them. I fear I have no information on the whereabouts of the other two.${prompt}
You may entrust the linkpearls to the acting commander of each regiment.${prompt}
This seal will serve to identify you as a member of the resistance.
Should anyone ask you for the password, it is “rose on the heath.”
Be swift, yet wary, ${name-player}!${prompt}
You must deliver those linkpearls to our missing regiments with all haste.
Remember, the password is “rose on the heath.”
Now be careful out there, ${name-player}!${prompt}
You there! This is a danger zone!
I suggest you get out of here, and quickly!${prompt}
A stray beam of light catches ${name-player}'s ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, causing it to gleam for a moment.
That seal...
Hm? “Rose on the heath”, you say?${prompt}
Reinforcements? Haha!
Well, why didn't you say so, my good--${prompt}
What's that? You've brought us a linkpearl?${prompt}
A most heartening turn of events, this.
Why, when we lost communication all of a sudden, my men and I feared the worst...${prompt}
You hand over ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}.
We were on patrol here when we got word that the base was under attack from the hordes.
With our other two squads such a long ways from home, we thought to make a swift return and aid in the defense.
Those fiends had other plans for us, though...${prompt}
We were ambushed, and barely escaped with our lives.
Lost some civilians too, we did...weighs heavy on this soldier's heart.${prompt}
What we really need is to return to base... But budge even an ilm from this place in our current state, and we'd be sitting slugs.
No, it's all we can do to keep the martello operational and tend to our wounded...${prompt}
Perhaps you could help us.
I beg of you. You can see the dire straits we are in.${prompt}
You see the fellow at work over there by that martello? That's Julio, an alchemist who's taken refuge in our camp.
In return for our protection, we've put him to task making basic supplies for us.
Talk to him and tell him you've come to help.${prompt}
We've suffered great losses, and morale is at an all-time low.
But your arrival has given us a glimmer of hope, faint as it still may be.
